News.Title: Digitide Solutions allots 62,338 shares under SOP
News.Summary: Digitide Solutions Limited allotted 62,338 equity shares under Special Purpose SOP 2025, increasing paid-up share capital to Rs. 1,490,117,510 with 149,011,751 equity shares.

News.Title: Digitide Solutions Q3FY26 Loss Widens to ₹20.50 Cr
News.Summary: Digitide Solutions reported consolidated net loss of ₹20.50 crores for Q3FY26 vs profit of ₹290.74 crores in Q3FY25. Revenue grew 6.51% to ₹7,803.03 crores. Company approved ESOS 2026 for 49.66 lakh stock options.

News.Title: Digitide Solutions Q3FY26 Earnings Call on Jan 30
News.Summary: Digitide Solutions Limited has scheduled an earnings conference call for January 30, 2026, at 9:30 AM IST to discuss Q3FY26 financial results with management participation.

News.Title: Digitide Solutions Reports 7% Revenue Growth, Tech & Digital Segment Surges 23% Year-on-Year
News.Summary: Digitide Solutions Limited reported quarterly revenues of INR 764 crores, marking 4% sequential and 7% year-on-year growth. The tech and digital segment demonstrated strong momentum with 16% sequential and 23% year-on-year growth, now contributing 30% of total revenue compared to 27% in the previous quarter. International business increased 6% sequentially and 4% year-on-year, accounting for 37% of total revenue. EBITDA stood at INR 85 crores with stable margins at 11.1%. The company achieved INR 550 crores in Total Contract Value (TCV) bookings for the third consecutive quarter exceeding INR 500 crores, while acquiring 24 new client logos. Digitide became a Tier-1 partner for both AWS and Azure and expanded its AI Center of Excellence in Bangalore. The company launched DigiAI Wave upskilling program targeting 10,000 professionals and was recognized as a major contender in six Everest peak metrics. Management reaffirmed its 3x3x3 strategy targeting USD 1 billion revenue by FY31, with expectations for margin expansion beginning in the fourth quarter as demerger-related expenses are now largely completed.

News.Title: Digitide Solutions Approves Financial Results and Relocates Registered Office in Bengaluru
News.Summary: Digitide Solutions Limited's Board of Directors approved the company's unaudited standalone and consolidated financial results for the second quarter and half year ended September 30, 2025, along with the limited review report from statutory auditors. The board also approved shifting the company's registered office within Bengaluru city limits from Bellandur Gate, Sarjapur Main Road to New Municipal No. 1, Sri Subramanya Plaza, BTM Layout 1st stage, Ring Road. The office relocation is effective from November 5, 2025, and was decided for better administrative convenience and effective coordination following the company's demerger from Quess Corp Limited as an independent entity.

News.Title: Digitide Solutions Targets $1B Revenue by FY31 with AI-Led Services Expansion
News.Summary: Digitide Solutions announced ambitious growth targets, aiming for 3x revenue growth to reach $1 billion by FY31. The company plans to achieve 200-300 basis points EBITDA margin expansion through scaling AI-led digital and BPM services, along with global partnerships with AWS and Azure. The tech and digital segment showed strong performance with 23% year-over-year growth. Despite facing a one-time demerger-related cost impact of ₹19 crore in H1FY26, the company maintained 6% year-over-year revenue growth and an 11.2% margin. The growth strategy is supported by diversified verticals and a global delivery footprint.

News.Title: Digitide Solutions Reports ₹139 Million Exceptional Loss from Corporate Restructuring
News.Summary: Digitide Solutions reported a one-time exceptional loss of ₹139 million resulting from a scheme of arrangement and business transfer involving demerged entities Bluspring Enterprises and other resulting companies. The loss is classified as exceptional, indicating it relates to corporate restructuring activities rather than regular business operations.

News.Title: Digitide Solutions Reports Q2 Net Loss of 17.8M Rupees Despite Revenue Growth
News.Summary: Digitide Solutions reported a net loss of 17.8 million rupees in Q2, compared to a profit of 214 million rupees in the same period last year. Revenue increased to 7.64 billion rupees from 7.14 billion rupees year-over-year. EBITDA declined to 851 million rupees from 1.03 billion rupees, while EBITDA margin compressed to 11.14% from 14.47% in the previous year.

News.Title: Digitide Solutions Says H-1B Visa Changes Won't Impact Operations
News.Summary: Digitide Solutions Limited announced that recent H-1B visa regulatory changes are not expected to have any material impact on its operations or financial performance. The company stated that its business has a diverse mix of onshore and offshore professionals with minimal reliance on H1B visas. The additional fees do not apply to existing employees who already hold valid H1B visas or visa renewals/extensions. India accounts for 65% of Digitide's consolidated revenues. The company remains committed to serving US-based clients with a combination of local and offshore talent while actively monitoring the situation for further developments.

News.Title: Digitide Solutions Reports 6% Revenue Growth in Q1 FY26, Completes Demerger from Quess Corp
News.Summary: Digitide Solutions reported consolidated revenue of INR 736 crores for Q1 FY26, marking a 6% year-on-year increase. The company completed its demerger from Quess Corp and became an independent listed entity on June 11, 2025. EBITDA stood at INR 83 crores with an 11.2% margin, while PAT was INR 10 crores (1.3% margin) after absorbing INR 9 crores in one-time listing costs. The BPM segment generated INR 539 crores revenue with 17% EBITDA margin, while tech and digital segment contributed INR 197 crores with 9.8% margin. The company secured 27 new client logos and launched 15 AI-led pilots during the quarter. Total contract value for Q1 was INR 523 crores. Domestic market contributed 64% of revenue while international markets accounted for 36%. The company maintains its 3x3x3 strategy to triple revenues by FY31 and expects margin expansion from the second half of the current fiscal year.
